channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Lower Separation Axioms for X-top Lattices
item.description: arXiv:2510.22355v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study separation axioms for $X$-top-lattices (i.e. lattices $L$ for which a given subset $X\subseteq L\backslash \{1\}$ admits a \emph{Zariski-like topology}). Such spaces are $T_{0}$ and usually far away from being $T_{2}.$% We give graphical characterizations for an $X$-top-lattice to be $T_{1},$ $% T_{\frac{1}{4}},$ $T_{\frac{1}{2}},$ $T_{\frac{3}{4}}$ and provide several families of examples/counterexamples that illustrate our results. We apply our results mainly to the prime (resp. maximal, minimal) spectra of prime (resp. maximal, minimal) ideals of commutative (semi)rings.
item.dc:creator: J. Abuhlail, A. Alfaraj

item.title: Kuratowski Monoids on Posets
item.description: arXiv:2504.14475v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Ciraulo recently showed that Kuratowski's closure-complement problem for arbitrary powersets of topological spaces extends constructively to the interior-pseudocomplement problem for arbitrary posets, using the closure-interior problem for posets (CIP) as a natural starting point. After a brief overview of CIP, we resolve two diagram-completeness problems left open by Ciraulo. Finally, we study operator semigroups arising from a little-known 1941 theorem of Chittenden, which generalizes CIP.
item.dc:creator: Mark Bowron

item.title: Connected components of schemes and primitive idempotents
item.description: arXiv:2401.05185v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In this article, we first prove a general result in topology which asserts that every quasi-component of a quasi-spectral space is connected. \\ As an application, we show that every connected component of a quasi-compact quasi-separated scheme is the intersection of all clopen (both open and closed) subsets containing a point. \\ In the next main result, we prove that for any scheme $S$ the connected components of the projective space ...
item.dc:creator: Abolfazl Tarizadeh

item.title: Menger and consonant sets in the Sacks model
item.description: arXiv:2406.05457v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Using iterated Sacks forcing and topological games, we prove that the existence of a totally imperfect Menger set in the Cantor cube with cardinality continuum is independent from ZFC. We also analyze the structure of Hurewicz and consonant subsets of the Cantor cube in the Sacks model.
item.dc:creator: Valentin Haberl, Piotr Szewczak, Lyubomyr Zdomskyy
